Reviews.Title: “A Place to Crash”
Reviews.Author: Arl7
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an unimpressive front staff. The beds were extremely hard and had other people's hair in the bedding. The shower head was set very low, my husband (5ft, 9") had to stoop down to shower. The water pressure was little more than a constant spit. On the positive side, the continental breakfast was ok, and the parking availability (leaving your car on site during a cruise) worked well. The complimentary shuttle to and from the cruise pier was convenient also, just minutes from the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Oshelbie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the night before our cruise. It is a great location for the cruise terminal, that is where all the good things end. Our room was not cleaned well. It is an older hotel. The bed was not comfortable. The worst part was the bathroom was infested with ants. I told the front desk at checkout and all he said "sorry about that ", no offer to resolve the issue you! I will never stay at the Sunrise again and would not recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay pre/post cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Herbieluvbug
Reviews.Content: For the price, this excellent value!! The rooms are a little dated but clean. The pool/hot tub area is nice and there is a great continental breakfast included. And the best part is the nice gentleman who runs the place has a free shuttle to and from the ship. It is within walking distance of all the little shops and restaurants on the wharf/dock area. I would definitely recommend this place for anybody before or after a cruise. I would not hesitate to stay here again. It was the best value for the money I could find in San Pedro!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Marites8
Reviews.Content: Sunrise San Pedro was the perfect location for our getaway with friends. It had complimentary breakfast, swimming pool, free parking and restaurants nearby. The staff were friendly staff and always willing to help. The breakfast was suffice to start our day right (various breads, cereals, coffee, fruit). It fine for us but it may not be enough for some. The swimming pool was clean, average size but it was not heated (only swam for 1 day). The rooms were outdated, beds were comfortable, pillows were small, there was a microwave and fridge, a separate sink to wash dishes and bathroom was clean. It was very basic. Location was close to beaches, easy access to main highway, near the harbour which was close to ships if you were going for the cruise. We were pretty lucky as we had the chance to go to the Taste in San Pedro Festival. Our room had a great view (see photos). It was a safe place to be in we did not encounter any issues....we even went for walks every night. We stayed at this hotel for 6 days in the 3rd floor across the stairs (it was a great spot). Note - wifi was only available in certain rooms of the hotel - you may want to inquire from the front desk before you get settled.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible, Horrible”
Reviews.Author: clz323
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely horrible!!!!!!!!!!! The customer service was unbelievable. Our family blocked off about 13 rooms in this hotel for New Years and they still treated us like dirt. The night before we arrived we tried booking another room and the lady in the front desk not only cussed at my fiance but also hung up on him after booking another room!!! At check out they tried charging us for 8 extra people in our room because late at night an employee thought he saw 8 people???? First off, we explained that eveyone was hanging out in our room,rightfully so, celebrating after our New Years party was over. We explained that after we hung out, everyone went back to their room to sleep. They argued and argued that we had 8 people in the room and they could not reverse what the employee had put into the system??? Are you freaking kidding me, we gave them business & had 13 rooms yet still they didnt understand the concept??????? Everything was so surreal.. never again and unless you want to have a heart attack due to the rage you will experience from this family owned business, do not stay there!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: BB_Kiddo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for wedding that was down the street. It was a perfect location for us since we could walk to several places to eat, drink, and attend the reception. While the rooms weren't exactly spectacular they were very clean and a great value for the price. The pool and grounds were well kept and the service suited us just fine. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive-as well it should be”
Reviews.Author: VijogeJoliet_ILUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sunrise Hotel for one night pre-cruise on 09.28.10. Purchased a king non-smoking room at hotels.com for $79. We arrived about 10 AM due to an early flight from MDW and the dest clerk said our room hadn't been cleaned yet but if we wanted to check in early he had either a king smoking or a double queen we could have. We opted for the king smoking, as it's been our experience in other hotels that it's not been a problem, especially as I used to smoke and the smell doesn't bother me. The desk clerk also commented that they usually charge additional money for early check-in but that he wouldn't charge us this time but he wanted us to be aware that they might not extend this courtesy the next time we stay there.. We were assigned room 127, first floor, with a view of the pool. Opening the door, the overpowering smell of stale cigarrette smoke was obvious. My fault, I know , because I ok'd the room. I just have never smelled such a stench in any hotel I've ever stayed at. We immediately opened the windows and turned on the fan, and several hours later the smell was gone. The room was good sized, king bed, a mini fridge, tv, a couple of chairs, desk with free wi-fi. I noted the stains on the arms of the upholstered chair and on the carpet. Hard to tell if these were permanent stains or if they were just dirty. We also noticed a lot of cobwebs in the corners near the floor. The king bed came with two postage stamp sized fiberfill pillows, which were about as pleasant to sleep on as a bag of potato chips. The continental breakfast was free, probably because they would have been embarrassed to charge for it. I drank a cup of coffee and then went to the restaurant next door to eat. My husband noticed his shirt was wrinkled from being in the suitcase and we couldn't find an iron in the room, even though the hotel brochure said they had them, so we decided to follow the time honored practice of steaming it in the shower. The water was extremely hot, and we had a nice steam going in minutes. When we opened the bathroom door to remove the shirt the steam set off the smoke detector. Funny thing, though, no one ever came to our room or called to see why. Good thing there wasn't a fire. . . Free wifi, and the shuttle to the cruise port was nice, but next time I'll stay elsewhere, probably just out by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Stooch
Reviews.Content: This was an older but clean hotel located near the cruise ship terminal which is good if you need an overnight stay before or after your cruise. If you're staying more than a couple of days you may want to choose elsewhere because it is located on a busy road and there is no guest laundry. The rooms are large, the beds were comfortable and the included continental breakfast buffet was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: njoys
Reviews.Content: I especially liked the wonderful continental breakfast. Our room was clean and comfortable. I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot my cell phone behind”
Reviews.Author: Griffith_jeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Sunrise (Best Western) Hotel 525 S. Harbor Blvd. Hotel, the room had ants all over specially in the bed, it woke me up in the middle of the night. The remote did not work and non-smoking rooms smelled like smoke. The first thing that we notice is that their customer service sucks, didn't want to spend time just answering a question regarding resturants in the areas. When we left we noticed that we forgot our cell phone on the bed, we called and the guys was very rude and told us to wait until the cleaning ladies were done with rooms. He said call back after 6pm, at 6pm I called to check on status, the lady that answered the phone didn't know anything about it, but she said there was no phone. I asked her if she asked the cleaning ladies? and she just said NO! call back tomorrow. I asked her for the manager's name, and she refuse to give me his name. She said that they are not allowed to give out his name, We were upset because they are just plain rude, we were very nice about the cell phone because it's our fault for forgetting it, but their service was really bad. When checking out, I told the front desk about the ants and he said Yeah, we have them all over. He had not concern about our complaint nor he cared to know about our phone. I say, NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SeniorAdvisorNevada
Reviews.Content: A number of guests attending a nearby wedding stayed at the Sunrise Hotel. While the hotel was very convenient to the wedding site at the Ports O Call restaurant, the accommodations were disappointing primarily for two reasons. First, except for individual rooms and the lobby, the building itself, like hallways, etc., was not air conditioned, apparently for cost savings. Most irritating was the widespread incidence of ants in the rooms that were occupied, which included the beds and bathrooms, apparently a well known and persistent problem to the staff.And finally, there was the minor issue of the toilet paper. While most hotels provide a reasonably good quality toilet paper, this was not true here. The quality was inexpensive and of the type one would find in marginal hotels in third-world countries.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: sea_cruise86
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel because of the location close to the cruise port. It was awful! If the hotels in the area hadn't been all booked due to the Long Beach Grand Prix I would have gone elsewhere. Upon check-in there was a note saying that there was no hot water in the hot tub. I thought, "Ok. Things like that happen." I did ask for a room with a view of the port. I was immediately told that two of the maids were out of maternity leave and that if I wanted a room, I had just better take what was available since they couldn't guarantee me how many more would be clean later and I might be left out in the cold. I didn't feel this was a time to argue the point. I took a room that was currently clean and we settled in. The free wireless internet was nice. We went out to eat and then came back for a good night sleep... or though we thought. In the wee morning hours (around 1am) there was yelling outside of our room door. Men were screaming at each other that they were going to beat each other up. It went on for a couple of minutes then silence. I then went back to sleep. An hour later it happened again. This time it only lasted about 30 seconds then silence again. There were no more incidents that night. We awoke in the morning to a wonderful day... or so we thought. We got up and I went in to take a nice shower. Well, it would have been nice if there were hot water. No matter which direction I turned the handle or how long I let it run it was pure cold. I began to wonder if I had read that sign in the lobby right the day before. I got dressed and went down there. Squinting at the sign I read it again. Yes, it did say the hot tub had no hot water. Nothing was mentioned about the rooms. I then asked the front desk about it. I was advised that since there were no clean rooms left (see maid problem above) that they might be able to find me a dirty room to shower in that was close to me. I declined. I knew that in just a couple of hours I would be on a cruise ship in my cabin that I knew would have hot water. Since I was dressed I decided to go have some breakfast that was free. It was ok. Nothing special. There were signs everywhere advising that you could not take food out of that room. Although I can look back on this and laugh now... I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: dudeBc
Reviews.Content: We booked here because it was close to the harbour (taking a cruise). Checked in at midnight to a room that was old & musty smelling. Needless to say we were a leary about sleeping... Bathroom has rust dipping from the pipes & mildew growing on the grout! The continential breakfast was not even worth touching. Most hotels have shuttles to the ports or there are taxis & shuttles available - look around for possibly a cleaner place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay At”
Reviews.Author: KevinClaremont_Ca_
Reviews.Content: I came down to this Hotel & stay 2 Wonderful Days . I stay at this Hotel for I can go out to Catalina Island for I can take Pictures & have some R & R from work.. I would Recommend this hotel for anyone . I got a GREAT Rate last year at $ 88 a night . I stay 2 Nights . I am planing on staying there again this Summer. For I can go out to Catalina Island again .I had nothing go wrong while I stay at this Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great for Buisness and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sandrail
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the week for business from Sept 18, 2008 - Oct. 15, 2008. Every time I checked in the staff was friendly, helpful, and very accomidating. I told them my needs for a long stay and they provided me with a room that fit perfectly and held the room for each week of my stay. It was clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The continental breakfast was just enough to start a busy day. The location was in walking distance to ports-of call with pleanty of restraunts for all budgets. It was in walking distance to neighborhood convience stores, and close to all major freeways and downtown Long Beach. I would stay there again anytime I travel to this area. John S., Oceanside, CA

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the ports”
Reviews.Author: ptscoot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little older but spotless. Nice pool and spa. There is a cute restaurant next door and if you are booked on a cruise ship they will escort you to the pier, unload your baggage and allow you to leave your car at their hotel for a nominal charge. They have security so the car will be protected. When your cruise is finished they will pick you up and deliver you to your car. We have used them 3 times and have never been disappointed. They are friendly, courteous, and at times a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RickSueFreeland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this "Hotel" March 23rd prior to catching a cruise. The condition of this property was terrible, and it was unkept. Actually found a used/discarded condom and it's wrapper within the bed sheets. Unfortunatley, the condom nor the wrapper belonged to me. We booked this because of Best Western's reputation. I have lodged a complaint to Best Western about this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in transition”
Reviews.Author: cjdmd
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on line to stay the night before catching a cruise ship at the harbor. The hotel had a bad odor. The personell seemed indifferent to any problems we had. The bedside light in our room would not work. When we got the maintanence to replace it, we had to unscrew and rescrew the bulb to turn it on. I could not recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Allfunallthetime
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute thing. We had a funeral in the family and needed a place close by. This one looked O.K. as we drove by. The parking lot was clean and the landscape was decently cared for. The lobby was dirty and the walls were especially dirty. The agent at the front desk was friendly and check in was quick. Our 2 queen room cost $129 plus tax for one night. The carpet in the hall and elevator was very dirty. Our room had 2 queen beds, 2 chairs and a table. The closet was more of a cabinet. The room was very dirty. We found the entire room to be pretty beat up with dirty walls, dirty upholstery, and threadbare sheets. Some of the lights did not work and the furniture was torn up. The view out the window was pretty as it faces the channel. We could sit and watch the cruise ships depart, and watch people stroll in a park across the street. At night the place was very loud. I think it was a combination of thin walls, and rowdy clientelle. This place seems like a stopover place for tourists heading out on a cruise the next day. Most are probably ready to party. While we were there the Best Western sign was being covered up, so I think that maybe they lost their designation. It does appear as if it used to be a decent place, but someone is cutting too many corners. They do have a free breakfast buffet but we did not participate. They also offer a PC in the lobby, but we did not use it. This place is on a downward spiral and will probably get worse. Not a good deal for $129.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: margaret5
Reviews.Content: Very bad experience. Not very clean and the room smelled of must, mold. I went on the internet searching for a place to park and stay near the carnival ship. This is not it. It is in San Pedro not near carnival. They lied. I was informed I had to contact them direct for the park and stay. You have to park your car in non secure parking lot. The morning breakfast is awfull. If you like cereal,bad toast and a bad waffle this is for you. No fruit or danish, just not much to choose from. When we arrived back I called the hotel and asked when to expect a shuttle. I was told in a few minutes. After about 15 minutes I called back and inquired as to how much longer. They said they were on there way. 15 more minutes passes and now they just hung up on me. I couldn't believe it. If it was going to be a while we would have taken a cab. So I called back 5 more times and they kept hanging up on me. Unbelieveable. all I wanted to know was should we take a cab. It was way over an hour we waited. This was bad way to end a great trip. Please don't make the mistake we made and stay here. Not anywhere near a 3 star maybe a 1 1/2

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Fiasco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel several times in the last few years. We stay there because we can leave our cars there when we leave on a cruise ship. The hotel has a shuttle that will deliver and pick you up from the port of call. I don't know if the hotel has changed hands, but we were treated extremely poor by the front office staff. They were rude when we called for reservations, when we checked in, and they were awful when we called for the shuttle to come pick us up after the cruise. What should have been a 20 minute wait turned into almost an hour. We called twice more to find out where the shuttle was and we were lied to that there was an accident on the bridge and that was causing the delay, we were lied to a second time when we were told the shuttle was picking up people at the other port, (our ship was the only ship in port on this day). When we were finally picked up I went into the office area to report our unhappiness at this situation, the front office woman by the name of Jerri Gable was extremely rude and never did apoligize for the inconvenience. I know that my family will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ColinThompson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June as the first stop on a 4 week holiday in the States, mainly to recover from the flight and the time shift. We loved Redondo Beach - very friendly, lots of very good eating places and far less hassle than other areas up the coast or elsewhere in LA. The Sunrise Hotel was good. Rooms have been refurbished recently - although not the hallways and common areas which look just a little shabby. We had a good big room overlooking the harbour with good modern en suite facilities. We particularly appreciated the free wireless internet, free local telephone calls and the excellent breakfast included in the rate. The one real problem was the noise of the aircon - it is a box under the window and even on low setting it sounds like a bus standing outside the window. Too loud to have running at night so if you stay here in July or August, be prepared for some hot nights.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Best Western a Bad Name”
Reviews.Author: mhuntmil
Reviews.Content: I walked into the lobby of this hotel to be greeting by flies buzzing all around. There was a garbage can overflowing outside, with flies everywhere. I came here at the recommendation of another hotel in the area that was sold out. At $110.00/night I expected much much more. The front desk person was very unfriedly and uninformed. I wanted to know if they had an internet connection and she said I would have to try to sign on in my room, as she didn't know which rooms had it and which ones did not. The elevator up to the second floor was broken, and I had to haul my luggage to my room. When I got to my room, though it was clean, it was beat up and extremly outdated. Because I am a single woman traveling on business, I really was not comfortable at this hotel, and found another one. 3 hours after I checked in I checked out. I had not stayed in this room, did not touch anything, all I did was place my luggage in the room. However, the management was very indignant and were going to charge me full price. After much discussion, they lowered the price by 1/3 My advice to anyone looking at this hotel is BEWARE. I have stayed in Best Western's before, and I am amazed this hotel is allowed to call itself a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: CrockettTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent for spending the night before a cruise. The $129 plus tax I paid for one night stay and 5 days parking my car during the cruise was reasonable (Pier parking $12 day). The desk staff was fast, courteous, and efficient. The morning breakfast person had everything ready when we went down for breakfast. The shuttle drivers to and from the cruise center excellent. The bed was hard and some light mold in the shower. The elevator was being serviced so we had to walk up to our room on the 3rd floor. That was not a problem, I needed the exercise. This establishment is OK for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great cruise buy”
Reviews.Author: lauraleigh9mm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Best Western on New Years Day. This is not a new hotel but it is OK. We payed $100 for the night. The room was fine and faced the pool. The elevator is a death trap, take the stairs. Breakfast was cereal and such with waffles. They offer a free shuttle to the port making this a good deal. There are nicer hotels further from the port so if you want to pay double and pay for a taxi, have fun. I would stay there again in a minute if I had to leave out of San Pedro

Reviews.Title: “Cruisers take note”
Reviews.Author: Peregrina651
Reviews.Content: On a budget? Found this to be the perfect place to stay the night before a cruise out of the World Cruise Terminal in San Pedro. While it might be showing its age a bit, our room and bathroom were clean and the beds were comfortable enough. The staff was courteous and helpful and the lobby was full of fellow cruisers. The breakfast buffet offered bagels, muffins and toast, cereals, juices, fruit and cook-em yourself Belgian waffles -- enough to hold you till you get aboard ship!

Reviews.Title: “Greedy & seedy”
Reviews.Author: unkwes
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this place except the ability to leave your car while going on a cruise. Used to be about $100 to stay a night and park your car in the back. Now they want $170 for a dumpy place with your car left in the back out in the open. STAY AWAY !!!

Reviews.Title: “Dog House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are only two good things to say about this hotel: 1) the close location to the port and 2) the restaurant next door. This place should almost be condemned. The carpet looked as if the doors had been opened for every stray dog in San Pedro to have run of the house. This could be a lovely place to stay when preparing to cruise because of the convenience. The owners should really consider revamping!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: nkMIA
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel room for the price. My room was very clean and spacious. Adequate parking available also. No problems with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone who would write a good review on this place, has probably not been to many hotels. Let us start with parking, there is none. There are signs all over the place warning you that if you park at Grinder's, the establishment next door, you will be towed. There is a guy in a car monitoring the lot just for that purpose. The hotel is old, we stayed on the 3rd floor with renevations in progress. They will have to work on the place for a long time. The rugs throughout are dirty and musty smelling. We kept the windows open with the air on to help with the smell. I rode the elevator once, and that was it for me! Servicing??? Needs replacement. There is a notice posted in the room that inventory of the towels will be taken each day and anything missing will be charged to your room. Who would want those towels??????? The bath towel is the size of the hand towel and the quality is that of the ones I would use for cleaning. You would never see such a notice at the most upscale hotels who use towels most people couldn't even dream of affording. Internet service is advertised, there is none. Couldn't even hook up to the phone line, it wasn't working. The only positive aspects, are the close proximity to the port (walking distance) and the bedding was clean (no stains or hair) and the toilet was clean. Even with those positives, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the service we received when checking in early after a cruise. We arrived at 11:30 am. Sunrise had our rooms available and they were very gracious in checking us in early. It is an older hotel, but the room we had was very large (compared to newer hotels). Our wing of the hotel was very quiet although I heard another guest complain about the noise in their wing. A wedding party was staying there. We had a great breakfast by the pool. My one concern was the elevator. It was noisy and made a strange clang. I kept wondering if it was in need of service. Also another bright spot was the restaurant next door - Grinders. We had lunch there the next day and had the best service we've had in a long time. I wish I could remember the waitress's name. My husband and I both commented on the service after leaving the restaurant, so it wasn't just me.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was awesome. Just missing some bacon...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi all, My husband and I were going on a cruise and decided to go a day early to San Pedro so we could do some sightseeing, so we booked at this hotel. It's very close to the port of LA as well as the port o' call villages so that's the main reason we stayed here. The shuttle service to the port is free with the 'fly & cruise' package so you just have to tip the driver and as far as the hotel staff goes, we had some mixed service but overall they're very sweet and accomodating. We got there early before check-in and they held our luggage so we could go sightseeing asap, but they led us to a side room to leave them in. Now this room had a lot of other junk in it (old beds, lamps that needed repair) so that was a bit of a shock. But hey, it was locked and they were watching it so that wasn't a biggie. After we walked around for a few hours, we went back to the hotel to get our luggage from the side room and then our room keys from the front desk. Now, the lobby area has a small kisok. We didn't think anything of it until the morning that we were leaving but we should have checked it sooner! It has a listing of eateries and sights in San Pedro, and how to get around with the trolley. You can also print out maps from this kiosk. So you reading this - don't forget to check out the kiosk. We did it but it was too late by then - we found out there was a classic car convention the day we came in. Oh well! Ohhhh and breakfast the next day was SO good, we were full like we were at a buffet! The only thing missing was meat- sausages or bacon or something, but otherwise they had everything else. There was a belgian waffle station, the juice station (oj, guava juice), there was a cereal station, a mini-bagel station with cream cheese and jam, and a toast and fruit station. Not to mention the coffee and the tea. Needless to say, we were very full and happy. We also grabbed some fruit (bananas, apples & oranges) to take back to our room to snack on. Now the piece de resistance. The room: Overall, it was great. It was well-kept and clean. The decor was outdated but we would rather have a clean room than up-to-date furniture. The AC was super-strong (and boy did we need it cuz it was a hot weekend) and the internet connection was fast and cheap. The tv had most channels (mtv, cnn) and there was a little fridge at the bottom of the tv cabinet. The bathroom was kinda small but it didn't bother us at all and the water from the shower was wonderful - strong pressure too. We stayed on the 2nd floor by the way. So hey, it's a great bargain for the price just for the breakfast alone. Other things: There's a restaurant next door but we don't recommend it. They had kind of bland food. Instead go to the Beach City Grill about 4 blocks up in the 'downtown' area. They have all kinds of meat and seafood dishes like plantain cakes and crab cakes and pasta and cinnamon iced tea.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to Feb. 17, 2005 cruise. Not Bad, good place for a quick overnight stay. Showers wer terrible. You would get more water from a glass of water. Free breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: LEEW13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the night here on feb 24,2004 and will say it is a great place to stay if you need to catch a cruise ship the next day. Its right across the street from the cruise terminal and they offer shuttle and park and stay options. The hotel is old and shows it the rooms are just that a bed and shower. The carpets were dirty and the rooms need a overhaul. Dont even think about getting in the jucuzzi did not look good!!! Any way if you need a room and want to be close to the ship it will work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: DaveGold
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, extremely friendly and helpfull staff. Parking is an issue but the staff will help you find should you have a problem finding one, they even offered us to leave the car keys with them and have it double parked. Price... the original price is a little expensive, but we got a good deal from the main Best Western office after mentioning to them that the price was a lot. They offer parking (for a nominal fee, that is cheaper than the cruise ship parking price) for the length of the cruise. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on three criteria. We needed parking, internet and a guest laundry. The web site showed the hotel had all three so we booked. Guess how many of these things we actually had. NONE!!! The parking was a shambles. We were doubled parked which was a nightmare, There was NO guest laundry and there was NO internet access in the rooms. It is dark smelly and dinghy. Pay the taxi fare from a decent hotel at Long Beach. I wish we had!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Sunrise Hotel San Pedro
HotelInfo.Address: 525 South Harbor Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90731 (Formerly Best Western Sunrise Hotel)
